extends java.lang.Object

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    private class  Render.Pixel
    Pixel is an internal helper class whose objects are associated with a Render object that they are generated in scope of.
    class  Render.weightRay
    weightRay help the AdaptiveSuperSampaling by weight every ray acording to the recursive depth

    • renderImage

      public void renderImage()

    • setMultithreading

      public Render setMultithreading​(int threads)
      Set multithreading
      - if the parameter is 0 - number of coress less 2 is taken
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the Render object itself

      Finding the closest point to the P0 of the camera.
      Parameters:
      intersectionPoints - list of points, the function should find from this list the closet point to P0 of the camera in the scene.
      Returns:
      the closest point to the camera

    • findClosestIntersection

      public Intersectable.GeoPoint findClosestIntersection​(Ray ray)
      Find intersections of a ray with the scene geometries and get the intersection point that is closest to the ray head. If there are no intersections, null will be returned.
      Parameters:
      ray - intersecting the scene
      Returns:
      the closest point

    • calcColor

      private Color calcColor​(Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint, Ray inRay, int level, double k)
      Parameters:
      geoPoint - the inter point
      inRay - the ray from the light source
      level - the depth of the recursive of the transparency and the reflection
      k - min transparency and reflection level we take in to count
      Returns:
      final color

      n - normal

      Returns:

    • calcSpecular

      private Color calcSpecular​(double ks, Vector l, Vector n, double nl, Vector v, int nShininess, Color ip)
      Calculate Specular component of light reflection.
      Parameters:
      ks - specular component coef
      l - direction from light to point
      n - normal to surface at the point
      v - direction from point of view to point
      nShininess - shininess level
      ip - light intensity at the point
      Returns:
      specular component light effect at the point

    • calcDiffusive

      private Color calcDiffusive​(double kd, double nl, Color ip)
      Calculate Diffusive component of light reflection.
      Parameters:
      kd - diffusive component coef
      nl - dot-product n*l
      ip - light intensity at the point
      Returns:
      diffusive component of light reflection

    • getRaysThroughPixel

    • getLightSourcesColors

      private Color getLightSourcesColors​(Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint, double k, Color result, Vector v, Vector n, double nv, int nShininess, double kd, double ks)
      Parameters:
      geoPoint - intersec point on object
      k -
      v - vec
      n - norml
      nShininess - Shininess factor of matireal
      kd - diffusive factor of matireal
      ks - specular factor of matireal calcs a shadow from light to object by sending multiply ray from point to light and calcs avg of ktr of all rays
      Returns:
      final color in point

    • AdaptiveSuperSampaling

      public java.util.LinkedList<Render.weightRay> AdaptiveSuperSampaling​(int nX, int nY, int j, int i, double screenDistance, double screenWidth, double screenHeight)
      Parameters:
      nX - number of pixel in x axis
      nY - number of pixel in y axis
      j - index in x axis
      i - index in x axis
      screenDistance - distance form camera to view plane
      screenWidth - screen width
      screenHeight - screen height check if all the pixel is in the same color and if so we will not start the recursive check
      Returns:
      list of weight rays , every ray acording to its recursive depth

    • recursivAdaptiveSuperSampaling

      public java.util.LinkedList<Render.weightRay> recursivAdaptiveSuperSampaling​(int nX, int nY, double screenWidth, double screenHeight, java.util.LinkedList<Render.weightRay> rays, Point3D thisPix, int level)
      Parameters:
      nX - number of pixel in x axis
      nY - number of pixel in y axis
      screenWidth - screen width
      screenHeight - screen height
      level - the depth of the recursive
      thisPix - the upper left point of the wanted part of pixel
      Returns:
      list of weight rays of the specipic recursive call

      Parameters:
      temprays -
      Returns:
      list of colors according to the list of rays

    • nineRaysThroPixel

      private java.util.LinkedList<Render.weightRay> nineRaysThroPixel​(Point3D point, double ratioX, double ratioY, int level)
      Parameters:
      point - the upper left point of the wanted part of pixel
      ratioX - x exil of pixel
      ratioY - y exil of pixel
      level - depth of recursive
      Returns:
      add 9 rays throw the wanted part in pixel to the list
